hb.math
Class DoubleArray

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--hb.math.DoubleArray
Direct Known Subclasses:
Potential
public class DoubleArray
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a multiway (multidimensional) array with any rank. The elements are of type double. You should use this class when you do not know the rank at compile time. Internally, the elements are placed in an one-dimensional array in a well defined order (according to mathematical operator called the vec-operator). It is possible to access the elements directly through this array, but it is recommended to use the methods available.

public DoubleArray sum(int[] dimension)
Sum the elements along the given dimensions and puts the result in a new DoubleArray with rank equal to current rank minus the number of dimensions that summed over.

multiply

public static DoubleArray multiply(DoubleArray X,
                                   DoubleArray Y,
                                   int[] XZmap,
                                   int[] YZmap)
Multiplies the two multiway arrays X and Y using the mapping of dimensions given by the two integer arrays XZmap[] and YZmap[]. The result is returned in a multiway array Z, where dim(Z) = dim(X) union dim(Y).
Returns:
a DoubleArray.

multiplyWith

public void multiplyWith(DoubleArray Y,
                         int[] YXmap)

multiplyElementwise

public static DoubleArray multiplyElementwise(DoubleArray X,
                                              DoubleArray Y)
Multiplies the two multiway arrays X and Y elementwise, i.e. they have to have same shape.
Returns:
a DoubleArray.

divideWith

public void divideWith(DoubleArray Y,
                       int[] YXmap)
Multiplies the two multiway arrays X and Y using the mapping of dimensions given by the two integer arrays XZmap[] and YZmap[]. The result is returned in a multiway array Z, where dim(Z) = dim(X) and dim(X) >= dim(Y).
Returns:
a DoubleArray.

divideElementwise

public static DoubleArray divideElementwise(DoubleArray X,
                                            DoubleArray Y)
Divide the two multiway arrays X and Y elementwise, i.e. they have to have same shape. The definition 0/0=0 is used.
Returns:
a DoubleArray.
